messages.subject: She said/she said was: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Re: spelling
messages.msgSnippet: I m not picking on the author of this post.. I m addressing this thread: please change the subject line on this so others can choose to follow it or not. I m
messages.messageBody:
I'm not picking on the author of this post.. I'm addressing this thread:
please change the subject line on this so others can choose to follow it or not. I'm just as guilty as anybody on forgetting to change subject lines but I think I/we should try to do.
Thanks,
Sarah
(changing the subject line myself although I'm undecided what it should be!)
----- Original Message -----
From: ElissaJC@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 30, 2001 11:31 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Re: spelling



This is getting difficult. Please reread what was said Bridget. She NEVER
applied it to everyone. That is clear by the phrase "the other" meaning YOUR
children. not everyones.
Elissa
>No, it works for two out of three kids in this household. I would not
>dream of trying to apply that statistic to the rest of the world. I
>would only use it to say that it is possibly for it to work and for it to
>not work having experienced both. What the percentages are for the rest
>of you is beyond my scope of knowledge.
> Bridget
>>
>> Apparently, according to Bridgets response, it works well for two
>> out of three kids. The other needs a different direction.
>>
>> Kolleen
